articles.title: New Carnivorous Plant Discovered in North America – Balances Trapping Prey and Being Pollinated - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Botanists at the University of Wisconsin–Madison and the University of British Columbia have discovered a new carnivorous plant in western North America. Triantha occidentalis makes its home in wetlands and bogs from Alaska to California and inland to Montana…
articles.content:
Triantha occidentalis produces flowering stalks with sticky hairs that can trap insects. New research confirms that the plant can digest these trapped prey. Credit: Danilo Lima

articles.title: Taliban press on, take another Afghan provincial capital - CBC.ca
articles.description: The Taliban on Monday took control of another provincial capital in Afghanistan, an official said. The city's fall was the latest in a relentless, weeks-long Taliban offensive as American and NATO forces finalize their pullout from the war-torn country.
